tttrlib

time-tagged time-resolved data processing

Getting Started Release Highlights for {{ release_highlights_version }} GitHub
  • Simple and efficient tools for TTTR data processing
  • Accessible to everybody, and reusable in various contexts
  • Built in C/C++ and wrapped for Python and NumPy
  • Open source, commercially usable - BSD license

Single-molecule fluorescence spectroscopy

Process single-molecule fluorescence data.

Applications: FRET, Anisotropy.
Methods: Burst selection, Lifetime analysis, and more...

Examples

Fluorescence correlation spectroscopy

Determine kinetics, diffusion times, and particle numbers.

Applications: Molecular kinetics, particle sizes, concentrations, affinities.
Methods: FCS, Gated correlation, Filtered correlation, and more...

Examples

Fluorescence imaging

Proccess and analyze TTTR fluorescence imaging data.

Applications: Imaging, FRET, interaction studies, etc.
Methods: FLIM, Phasor analysis, sub-ensemble analysis, and more...

Examples

Image correlation spectroscopy

Analyze imaging data to determine species mobility and concentrations.

Applications: Mobility & number analysis

Examples

Photon distribution analysis

Recover fluorescence lifetimes and distance distributions.

Applications: Interaction studies, recover distances
Methods: MLE, and more...

Examples

TTTR processing

Feature extraction and normalization.

Applications: Transforming input data such as text for use with machine learning algorithms.
Algorithms: preprocessing, feature extraction, and more...

Examples

News

  • On-going development: What's new (Changelog)
  • April 2021. tttrlib 0.21.2 is available for download (Changelog).
  • tttrlib from 0.21 requires Python 3.7 or greater.
